Class Language

  • java.lang.Object
    • Language

  • public class Language
extends java.lang.Object
    The language class represents an individual language supported by the prototype decipher program. At this time, only English and Spanish are supported.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Language

        public Language(java.lang.String langName,
                java.lang.String dictFile,
                java.lang.String quadFile,
                java.util.Set<java.lang.String> dictionary,
                java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.math.BigDecimal> quadProbability)
        The constructor that requires each instance variable to be set when the constructor is called. This constructor is not used because each language is loaded using GSON in the langConfig class. It was created for future use.
        Parameters:
        langName - the name of the language that the instance represents.
        dictFile - the local path to the dictionary for the language the instance represents.
        quadFile - the local path to the quadgram count file for the language the instance represents.
        dictionary - a set that represents the dictionary loaded from the dictFile.
        quadProbability - a Hashmap with each quadgram and its probability in the language the instance represents.

    • Method Detail

      • calcQuadProbability

        public void calcQuadProbability()
        the calcQuadProbability method is responsible for calculating the probability of each quadgram in a given language. quadgram probability is used as a fitness measure when attempting to locate the most fit plain text solution for the cipher text. this method makes use of the big decimal and big integer classes offered in the java math package because our quadgram counts are certain to cause numeric overflow, and the probabilities are certain to cause numeric underflow. To further avoid the issue of numeric underflow, the method takes the log function of each probability.

      • getLangName

        public java.lang.String getLangName()
        the get method used to retrieve the language name and ensure encapsulation.
        Returns:
        a String of the language name for the language the instance represents.

        the set method used to set a new language name and ensure proper encapsulation.

      • getQuadProbability

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.math.BigDecimal> getQuadProbability()
        the get method used to access the quad probability of the language and ensure proper encapsulation.
        Returns:
        a hashmap containing each quadgram's probability for the language instance.

      • setQuadProbability

        public void setQuadProbability(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.math.BigDecimal> quadProbability)
        the set method used to set a new quad probability hashmap and ensure proper encapsulation.
        Parameters:
        quadProbability - a Hash map with a String key and a BigDecimal value to replace the current hashmap in the language instance.
